result.execSummary:
The defendant Vic Marvin Winston was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all of following by the end of supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:  All court costs, fees, and surcharges including DNA.  If revoked, to be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under SEc. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
All applicable fees of supervision.

Provide a DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; also that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

No alcohol or drugs.
No possession, consumption, selling, distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
Follow all rules of supervision.  Follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
AODA assessment.  Cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.  Absolute/maintain sobriety.  Random urine screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Vic Marvin Winston

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Letters in Support of the defendant received and filed.

Defendant Vic Marvin Winston in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  3.5 YEARS with 0 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1.5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program but IS eligible for the WI Substance Abuse program.  

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 2 YEARS probation.  

Conditions of Probation/ Extended Supervision if revoked:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 
-  If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Vic Marvin Winston in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for final pre-trial, however parties would like to proceed with a plea hearing instead.  Jury trial date of 8/12/15 is vacated.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Victoria Mccandless in court, defendant Vic Marvin Winston not in court, in custody. Nick Cerwin for Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for 8/7/2015 at 8:30 am and JURY TRIAL on 8/12/2015 at 9:00 am.   Parties advised effective August 1, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22, Room 608 of the Courthouse.

Attorney Victoria Mccandless in court, defendant Vic Marvin Winston not in court, in custody.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defense received the search warrant affidavit that was requested. Case calendared for STATUS on 6/22/2015 at 1:30 pm in Branch 15.

Attorney Victoria Mccandless in court, defendant Vic Marvin Winston not in court, in custody. Nick Cerwin for Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defense is still missing discovery items. Case calendared for STATUS on 6/12/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Defendant Vic Marvin Winston in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant Vic Marvin Winston in custody.  Ronald Dague for Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE POINT for Supervision.
Court orders defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY and to be monitored by drug tests and portable breathalyzers. 
Court orders no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription. 
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Vic Marvin Winston in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant Vic Marvin Winston in custody.  
David A. Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
